title: Volume of homeowner equity in the U.S. 1960 to 2018
yAxis: Homeowner equity in trillion U.S. dollars
summary: Overall Homeowner equity in trillion U.S. dollars has decreased over the Year.

Homeowner equity in trillion U.S. dollars is slightly increasing from 2003 to 2005, roughly constant from 2005 to 2006, gradually decreasing from 2006 to 2008, and finally roughly constant from 2008 to 2011.
The steepest decrease occurs in between the Year 2007 and 2008.
Maximum Homeowner equity in trillion U.S. dollars, about 13.27 was reported at Year 2005
Minimum Homeowner equity in trillion U.S. dollars about 6.16 was reached at Year 2010
